thread.title: Sauli Niinistö, President of Finland, has a great dog called Lennu | Metro News
thread.title_full: Sauli Niinistö, President of Finland, has a great dog called Lennu | Metro News

author: Ashitha Nagesh For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Sauli Niinistö, President of Finland, has a great dog called Lennu | Metro News
text:
Ashitha Nagesh for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 9:30 am Hallo (Picture: Office of the President of the Republic of Finland) 
The President of Finland has an excellent, top quality dog. 
His name is Lennu, a five-year-old Boston terrier who often accompanies President Sauli Niinistö at official events. 
However, he’s not exactly camera trained – and is usually seen running around with a toy in his mouth, distracting pretty much everyone around. 
For example, here’s some footage of Lennu bounding about during the Finnish Lucia service last December. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
He’s been pretty popular in Finland for a while, but for some reason (the dire state of our own politics, perhaps) he’s now become an international celebrity. 
Yes, amidst all the chaos of Trump and Brexit, Twitter has blown up with pictures of Lennu. excuse me but are you aware of Lennu, the Finnish president's dog pic.twitter.com/sBVSOiExw6 
— Kelly Weill (@KELLYWEILL) February 22, 2017 ever since seeing that tweet earlier I can't stop looking at pictures of Sauli Niinistö's dog ffs pic.twitter.com/bdTCjYTlKJ 
— minna helena (@minna_helena) February 22, 2017 The President of Finland and is dog is everything pic.twitter.com/c8nKtbUWuv
